text: I often think about how my actions affect others.
Helping someone in need feels more rewarding than achieving a personal goal.
I feel a sense of responsibility for the well-being of my community.
I find it difficult to ignore someone who is clearly in distress.
I often consider other people's perspectives before making a decision.
I believe most people deserve compassion, even if they have made mistakes.
I am more likely to help someone if I feel a personal connection to them.
I feel uncomfortable when I see others being treated unfairly.
I believe it is important to stand up for people who cannot stand up for themselves.
I sometimes put the needs of others above my own, even when it is inconvenient.
I regularly volunteer my time to help others, even without personal gain.
I prioritize fairness when mediating conflicts between others.
I often feel empathy for strangers I encounter in difficult situations.
I find myself motivated to make a difference in the lives of those less fortunate.
I am willing to take personal risks to help someone in need.
I enjoy working with others to achieve a goal that benefits the community.
I often give others the benefit of the doubt in difficult situations.
I feel a personal responsibility to address injustices in my community.
I often put others' needs ahead of my own comfort or convenience.
I believe showing kindness to others creates a ripple effect that improves society.
